New Records: Jos Buttler scored 83 off 38 balls, the fastest fifty in a T20 World Cup semi-final since 2016 and the second-fastest fifty in a T20I match ever (beating the record of 12.5 overs set by AB de Villiers in 2015).
Chris Jordan became the first England bowler to take a hat-trick in a T20 World Cup match.
Adil Rashid took 2 wickets for 13 runs, the second cheapest 2-wicket spell in T20 World Cup history after Rashid Khan's 2-16 against Sri Lanka in 2019.
Key Match Events: Chris Jordan took a hat-trick and four wickets in five balls, including dismissing Aaron Jones, the USA captain, with his fourth delivery to complete the hat-trick.
Jos Buttler hit five sixes in an over, the first player to do so in a T20 World Cup match since David Hussey in 2012.
England scored 117 for 0 in 9.4 overs, the fastest score by any team in a T20 World Cup match (beating the record of 12 overs set by New Zealand against Sri Lanka in 2009).
Pre-Game Insights: England captain Jos Buttler said they had 'paid USA a lot of respect' but focused on their intensity.
The match was England's first since their rain-disrupted game against South Africa, which ended in a 7-wicket loss on June 18, 2024.
Post-Match Reflections: England coach Chris Silverwood praised the team's ability to adapt after the rain interruption and said the win was a 'great confidence booster'.
USA captain Aaron Jones said the team's performance had 'opened the eyes of the American public' and they were 'grateful' for their progress in the tournament.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played in Barbados, where Chris Jordan and Aaron Jones had attended school together.
The result confirmed England's place in the semi-finals, with their opponents to be determined within 48 hours.
Others: The game was broadcast live on BBC Radio 5 Sports Extra and featured commentary from the Test Match Special team.
